results.title: America abroad
results.creator_credit: Michael Ingrams, Peter Hunt, Intertel and Associated-Rediffusion
results.brief_description: Approximately 2,000,000 United States citizens live and work abroad, in some 70 nations which benefit from American aid. Four of these countries and some of these United States citizens are in Cambodia, Vietnam, Pakistan and Ghana.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Ingrams, Peter Hunt, Intertel and Associated-Rediffusion

results.title: Amazon to ice
results.brief_description: Explore the wonderous waterways of South America from the infamous Tierra del Fuego to the raging rapids of the Upper Amazon; an area studded with relics from the ancient Inca past. A truly breathtaking journey includes the Moreno Glacier, the face of the Iguazu Falls and a visit to the inhabitants of the Islands in Lake Titicaca.

results.title: Am I Normal? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Am I Normal? is a humorous situation comedy about the experiences boys go through during puberty. It presents facts about male sexual development while simultaneously raising important issues about masculinity, identity and peer pressure.
results.description: Am I Normal? is a humorous situation comedy about the experiences boys go through during puberty. It presents facts about male sexual development while simultaneously raising important issues about masculinity, identity and peer pressure.

results.title: Always was, always will be
results.creator_credit: Nick Power, Madeline McGrady and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the fight by contemporary Aboriginal people, for land rights and for the recognition by white Australia that the British colonisation of this continent was illegal and has yet to be compensated for. Interviews with Aboriginal activists from the Northern Territory and New South Wales make it clear that while the government pays lip-service to the language of land rights, Aboriginal people have yet to receive full access to their land. Includes interviews with Pat Dodson, Marcia Langton and Michael Mansell.

results.title: Alternator 15
results.brief_description: With the tendency of cars to be fitted with more electrical equipment it is becoming increasingly important to fit an alternator rather than a dynamo. This film examines the advantages of an alternator and shows research, aided by computers, into the most acceptable design

results.title: Alphabet
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An amusing and energetic romp through the letters of the alphabet, wittily animated by Elliot Noyes Junior. Each letter has its own objects, animals or actions to suggest words it begins - A for Apple, Z for Zebra. None, however, retains the expected form for long, fading, changing at the artist’s whimsy. For anyone at the reading-readiness stage, young or old, this is a language film to sharpen words and humour.

results.title: Alouette, Canada's first satellite
results.creator_credit: C R Yool, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Design, construction, function, and launching of Canada’s first earth satellite. On the other side of the ionosphere, Alouette tracks the solar disturbances that affect radio communication and transmits much useful information for research purposes. Uses animated diagrams.

results.title: Along these lines
results.brief_description: A history of the way in which language enlarged the communication capacity of the human animal and how the telephone expanded and transformed the functions of language. Made for the Bell Telephone Company in Canada.
